oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cavalry & Dragoons (1855-1858)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the mid 1850s Congress authorized the creation of two cavalry regiments to augment the already existing 1st and 2nd Dragoons and the Mounted Rifle Regiment. Designated the 1st and 2nd Cavalry Regiments, the units received coats trimmed in gold to distinguish them from the dragoon coats trimmed in orange. H.A. Ogden created 47 illustrations depicting the American soldier from the Revolution to 1888 and received $100 for each work.
